thread.title: Drug catapult found attached to Arizona-Mexico border fence

title: Drug catapult found attached to Arizona-Mexico border fence
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Drug catapult found attached to Arizona-Mexico border fence Border Patrol discovers catapult used to throw bundles of pot over Arizona-Mexico border. Post to Facebook Drug catapult found attached to Arizona-Mexico border fence Border Patrol discovers catapult used to throw bundles of pot over Arizona-Mexico border. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2lNX4GX Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Drug catapult found attached to Arizona-Mexico border fence USA Today Network Eric Newman, The Arizona Republic 10:57 p.m. ET Feb. 14, 2017 Border Patrol agents dismantled a drug-throwing catapult on the Mexican side of the border. (Photo: U.S. Customs and Border Protection) 46 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
PHOENIX â€” U.S. Border Patrol agents discovered a catapult used to throw bundles of marijuana over the Arizona-Mexico border into Douglas, according to U.S. Customs and Border Protection. 
While patrolling an area near the Douglas Port of Entry on Feb. 10, agents saw several people quickly retreating from the fence as the agents approached, officials said. 
When agents arrived, they searched the area and located two bundles of marijuana, weighing more than 47 pounds combined, as well as a catapult system attached to the Mexico side of the border fence. 
Mexican law-enforcement authorities responded to the area and seized the catapult system, which was dismantled by the U.S. Border Patrol, officials said. 
Agents dismantled the catapult system. (Photo: U.S. Customs and Border Protection)
